item.description:
The Concord Festival of Authors
and
The Walden Woods Project's
Stewardship Lecture Series
Present:

An Evening with E.L. Doctorow

E.L. Doctorow's work has been published in thirty languages. His novels include City of God, Welcome to Hard Times, The Book of Daniel, Ragtime, Loon Lake, Lives of the Poets, World's Fair, Billy Bathgate, The Waterworks, and The March. Among his honors are the National Book Award, two National Book Critics Circle awards, the PEN/Faulkner Award, the Edith Wharton Citation for Fiction, the William Dean Howells Medal of the American Academy of Arts and Letters, and the presidentially conferred National Humanities Medal. E.L. Doctorow lives in New York.

FYI only; not a CMF event.


Adult $15 / Student $5
For reservations, call 781-259-4707


~ ~ ~
